content.title: Derivation of Planck Time via Dimensional Analysis
content.summary: Step-by-step derivation of the Planck time t_P from fundamental constants c, ℏ, and G using dimensional analysis.

alternative_derivation.interpretation: Planck time is the light-travel time across one Planck length

verification.check_dimensions: [ℏG/c⁵] = [M L² T⁻¹ × M⁻¹ L³ T⁻² / L⁵ T⁻⁵] = [L⁵ × T⁻³ / L⁵ × T⁻⁵] = [T²] → √[T²] = [T] ✓

content.physical_interpretation: The Planck time is the unique time constructible from fundamental constants. It represents the shortest meaningful time interval in physics, below which the concept of time itself may break down.
